articles.title: Emaciated deer seen in Alabama woods spark outbreak fears - AL.com
articles.description: Hemorrhagic disease is caused by a virus and transmitted by tiny biting insects. The virus causes internal hemorrhaging and hurts the deer’s ability to eat and digest food.
articles.content:
Alabama wildlife officials are on the lookout for reports of sick deer after reports of an increase in sickness in neighboring Mississippi.

articles.title: COVID-19 vaccinations may have saved lives of 100 Maine seniors in first 5 months, study says - Press Herald
articles.description: The federal study released Tuesday came as Maine reported 897 new cases of COVID-19 and 10 deaths over three days.
articles.content: Maine may have avoided 800 COVID-19 infections, 300 hospitalizations and 100 deaths among seniors during the first five months of this year because of access to vaccinations, according to a federal s… [+5090 chars]
